Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.autodownload

Class PlaylistConfigBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.autodownload.PlaylistConfigBuilder
  • public class PlaylistConfigBuilder
extends Object
    A playlist config builder which uses a builder pattern to configure the parameters for a new IPlaylist.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlaylistConfigBuilder()
      Default constructor, which uses default values for all options apart from playlist name.
      PlaylistConfigBuilder​(IPlaylistConfig src)
      A constructor which can create a new builder from a previous config object.

    • Method Detail

      • withName

        public PlaylistConfigBuilder withName​(String name)
        Set the name for the new playlist. The name is the unique identifier for a playlist.
        Parameters:
        name - The required playlist name.
        Returns:
        The playlist builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        IPlaylist.getName()

      • requirePlayback

        public PlaylistConfigBuilder requirePlayback​(boolean playbackRequired)
        Controls smart-download trigger logic. Smart-download is triggered when an asset is deleted via VirtuosoAsset.deleteAsset, OR when an Asset expires after playing. On trigger, this property is checked to see whether the Asset must ALSO have been played. If isPlaybackRequired is TRUE, and the Asset has NOT been played, smart-download is skipped. Default is TRUE. TRUE: Asset must have been played before smart-download starts. FALSE: Asset does not have to have been played before smart-download is triggered.
        Parameters:
        playbackRequired - the selected value for playback required
        Returns:
        The playlist builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        IPlaylist.isPlaybackRequired()

      • considerAssetHistory

        public PlaylistConfigBuilder considerAssetHistory​(boolean assetHistory)
        Controls smart-download next download selection logic. Enabling this option will cause smart-download selction logic to consider asset history in addition to Playlist history, when determine what the next item to be downloaded on a Playlist. Example: 1) User downloads, plays, then deletes asset X 2) Next month, A playlist is created for which asset X is a member. VirtuosoPlaylistConfig is created with following settings: isAssetHistoryConsidered = TRUE isPlaybackRequired = TRUE 3) During smart-download find next, asset X will be skipped in Playlist, history shows asset X was downloaded, played, then deleted. Default is FALSE. TRUE: Check asset history FALSE: Do not check asset history.
        Parameters:
        assetHistory - the selected value for consider asset history.
        Returns:
        The playlist builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        IPlaylist.isAssetHistoryConsidered()

      • searchFromBeginning

        public PlaylistConfigBuilder searchFromBeginning​(boolean search)
        Controls smart-download next playlist item search logic. Default is FALSE. TRUE: Search from beginning of playlist, for first Asset (excluding asset that triggered smart-download) that does not exist on the device, and which has not been previously downloaded and deleted. FALSE: Search from Asset that triggered smart-download to next item in playlist that does not exist on the device, and which has not been previously downloaded and deleted.
        Parameters:
        search - the selected value for search from the beginning
        Returns:
        The playlist builder for chaining.
        See Also:
        IPlaylist.isSearchFromBeginningEnabled()

      • build

        public IPlaylistConfig build()
        Build and return the IPlaylistConfig from the currently configured builder.
        Returns:
        The config object which can be passed to IPlaylistManager.create(IPlaylistConfig) or IPlaylistManager.create(IPlaylistConfig, List)
